text: what we're saying is look a open modern
democracy like Britain yes we need
migration we benefit from migration but
that migration must be controlled and
one of the problems we've had in recent
years is because we have created more
jobs than the rest of the European Union
put together we've seen very high rates
of migration now one of the ways we want
to address that is to make sure that
people can't immediately come here and
access our generous in work benefit
system I think that's been an additional
draw to our country but Teresa May has
been an excellent Home Secretary taking
a whole series of measures like closing
down the bogus colleges that weren't
really colleges at all putting a cap on
migration economic migration from
outside the European Union but it's
quite clear we need to do more to bring
migration into better balance because as
Teresa's will say in her speech today
if you want to integrated successful
society yes you want immigration but you
want it at a rate where you can properly
integrate people and bring them into our
society make sure that the school places
are there and the hospitals aren't
overcrowded and the pressure on our
country isn't too great and I think it's
absolutely right what she's saying today
the phrase she's using is a cohesive
society if you want a cohesive society
so you can't have it both ways that what
that means is what you're saying is the
country is breaking apart because of
those people are coming here and if you
look at the statistics of course 183
thousand of those are EU citizens who've
come here so are you saying that those
people are jeopardizing the way we live
no what we're saying is look we should
be incredibly proud in this country that
we have built one of the most successful
multiracial multi-ethnic democracies
anywhere on earth and it's something we
should be incredibly proud of and that
requires us to maintain the stance of
being a country that is open to talent
and people coming here and building a
life here but immigration should mean
controlled immigration and the point
that Therese is making is that if the
numbers get too great it becomes more
difficult to build the cohesive and
integrated multiracial multi-faith
society that we want to see
